title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: NixNa R package designed efficiently handle missing data, providing two essential functions: trimcovNa() trimun(). functions focus removing rows missing values specified covariate columns handling unique values missing covariates, respectively. install.packages(“devtools”) library(dev tools) devtools::install_github(“sarraalii/NixNa”) library(Nixna)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: function removes rows missing values specified covariate column, allowing clean dataset eliminating observations lacking essential information specific variable.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
code: data(conflictdata) target_column <- "country_name" covariate_columns <- c("GDP", "pops", "urban", "male_edu") cleaned_data <- trimcovNa(conflictdata, target_column, covariate_columns)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: trimun() function removes rows associated unique values missing covariates. particularly useful working datasets unique values must retained incomplete certain covariate columns.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
code: data(conflictdata) unique_column <- "country_name" covariates <- c("GDP", "pops", "urban", "male_edu") cleaned_data <- trimun(conflict data, unique_column, covariates)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: welcome contributions enhance functionality usability NixNa. suggestions encounter issues, please feel free open issue submit pull request.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: project licensed MIT License - see LICENSE.md file details.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: appreciate open-source community contributions support making NixNa valuable tool handling missing data. Happy coding NixNa!

Data to demonstrate the trimNa and trimcovNa function
Description:

  The dataset includes various socio-economic indicators. — conflictdata

text: function removes rows data frame specified column missing value another specified column.

text: data data frame. target_col column name rows removed condition_col NA condition_col column name missing values check

what: Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
title: Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
text: trimun function removes rows unique values specified column least one specified covariates missing.

title: Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
text: df data frame. unique_column character string specifying column unique values. covariates character vector specifying covariate columns.

title: Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
text: data frame rows removed unique values missing covariates.

title: Remove Rows for Unique Values with Missing Covariates — trimun
code: if (FALSE) { # Load the trimun package library(trimun)  # Specify the column and covariates unique_column <- "country_name" covariates <- c("GDP", "popdens", "urban", "male_edu")  # Call the function cleaned_data <- trimun(conflictdata, unique_column, covariates) }
